title: Data relating to Sheffield City Council's statement responding to the investigation of use of LPP, published by The Yorkshire Post 28/05/21

content:
Dear Sheffield City Council,
For context; The Yorkshire Post published the following article on 28th May 2021, reporting that Sheffield City Council had appointed a firm of solicitors to address a complaint made relating to the common practice of council officers, elected members and third party contractors deliberately quoting Legal and Professional Privilege when the exemption did not in fact apply:
https://www.yorkshirepost.co.uk/news/pol
...
In the article linked above the following statement was provided by Sheffield City Council:
"A Sheffield City Council spokesperson said: “In March 2021 the council received a complaint from a member of the public about the use of legal privilege in emails and FOI.
“This matter has been looked at previously and submissions made to the Information Commissioner's Office who, at the time, were satisfied with the council’s response. However, in line with the council’s complaints procedure, where matters relate to elected members, this is being considered further and is standard procedure.""
Please provide any and all information associate with the statement by SCC to The Yorkshire Post as quoted above. This would, although not exclusively, capture the following information:
1. All information associated in anyway with the generation of the statement issued by SCC.
2. All information generated and related in any way to questions raised by The Yorkshire Post relating to this matter.
3. Any and all correspondence between the Council and the Information Commissioner's office as referred to in the statement by Sheffield City Council associated with this matter.
Yours sincerely,
Mr. Buxton

Dear Mr. Buxton,
Thank you for your request for information relating to Statement to the
Yorkshire Post RE investigation of use of LPP exemption which we received
on 28/05/2021.
This has been logged as a Freedom of Information Request and will be dealt
with under the Freedom of Information Act 2000. The reference number for
your request can be found above.
Please be aware that Sheffield City Council’s response to the global
COVID-19 pandemic has led to a reduction in resources across the Council,
meaning that we are currently dealing with a backlog of requests.
The Freedom of Information Act 2000 states that we must respond to you
within 20 working days, by 28/06/2021, but we kindly ask for your patience
as we anticipate that there may be a delay in some cases. Please do not
hesitate to contact us at the email address below if you have any queries.
Yours sincerely,
Sheffield City Council

Sheffield, S1 1UJ

Dear Mr Buxton
RE: [1][FOI #760515 email]
We sincerely apologise for not answering this request within the deadline
prescribed by legislation.
In the light of the publication of the Lowcock Report, and the city
council’s acceptance of the Report and its recommendations, we are writing
to ask if you still want us to respond to this request.
If we don’t hear from you, we will close it.
If at any time in the future, you want to re-open it, please let us know.
Kind regards

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Many thanks for finally contacting me regarding this extremely overdue Freedom of Information request from 28th May 2021.
You refer the 'Lowcock report' in your email, nothing in the report provides me with the information requested.
Please continue in responding to my original request (the data should be supplied immediately) and also explain in detail why the council have previously failed to adhere to the relevant legislation in such a blatant manner.
Yours sincerely,
Mr. Buxton

Dear Sheffield City Council,
Thanks again for contacting me on 12th Aug  2023 regarding this long outstanding FoI request.
Further to my response on 13th Aug, I'd be very grateful if you could update me regarding this matter.
Kind regards
Mr. Buxton
